intro: Gueldenstaedtia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically narrow and elongated. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to regions of Eurasia, particularly in the temperate climates of Eastern Europe and Central Asia. Gueldenstaedtia stenophylla thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, and it is often found in disturbed or nutrient-poor soils.
